title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the highest snowfalls with Salisbury and Beverly receiving 13 inches on February 7, 2026.
The National Weather Service received snowfall reports from trained spotters and amateur radio operators across Massachusetts.
Greater snowfall was reported in eastern Massachusetts, with notably lesser amounts in southern and western counties.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, with the Patriots facing the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Tirico will also work on NBC's Olympic coverage, handling studio hosting duties for 'Primetime in Milan' after the game.
Coverage includes Cris Collinsworth as analyst, with Maria Taylor hosting pregame show starting 1 p.m. on NBC and Peacock.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs in Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara, California.
Drake Maye aims to become the youngest Super Bowl-winning quarterback at 23; previously finished as NFL MVP runner-up.
Seahawks hold the NFL's top scoring defense; Patriots counter with the second-highest scoring offense this season.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid for advice ahead of his first Super Bowl as a head coach.
Vrabel leaned on offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels's experience, who has participated in 10 Super Bowls.
Practicing halftime simulation, Vrabel mirrored strategies used by Belichick and Reid to prepare for Super Bowl LX.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim for their seventh Super Bowl win, potentially breaking the tie with Pittsburgh for most wins.
Drake Maye seeks to join elite company as the fifth second-year quarterback to win a Super Bowl.
Mike Vrabel could become the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both a player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs is aiming for a Super Bowl LX win with the Patriots to bolster his Hall of Fame case.
Diggs has 11,504 receiving yards, ranking 38th all-time, and is 43rd in touchdown receptions with 73.
Only two Super Bowl MVP-winning wide receivers, Jerry Rice and Lynn Swan, have been inducted into the Hall of Fame.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots and one with the Colts, totaling 2,673 points in his NFL career.
Vinatieri is renowned for his clutch performances, including two Super Bowl game-winning field goals in the final seconds.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a long halftime break during Patriots' final Super Bowl practice at Stanford Stadium.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye practiced fully despite a prior shoulder issue, while Landry and Spillane were limited.
Bad Bunny is the halftime show performer with potential guest Cardi B, Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs' girlfriend.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Quarterbacks Drake Maye and Sam Darnold face off in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
Drake Maye overcame three top-five defenses, committing turnovers in two playoff games before a clean AFC Championship.
Sam Darnold excelled in the NFC Championship, but struggled with turnovers during the regular season with 14 interceptions.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pleaded guilty to OSHA violations after an employee's fatal accident in September 2023.
The Massachusetts company admitted neglecting safety measures, leading to Josué Tiquiram's death from a malfunctioning soil screener.
The company faces up to five years probation and a $500,000 fine; sentencing is set for May 4.
